result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph B Delatorre was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) AMENDED FROM Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.
Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.
Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

Bond forfeiture notice -
     Order forfeiting bail and notice of application for judgment.  Court ordered forfeiture due to bond violation and new charges being filed.
Status conference on September 30, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Must attend 3 self-help meetings per week and provide written proof of attendance to ZCI.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
